Reviews.Content: Just pefect place to stay with family on budget Overall experience excellent. Everything you need in a large room. All perfectly maintained, as far as facilities  kitchen supples.Comfy bed, seating area  sofa bed.Cable TV  AC with climate control. Large furnished lanai for evening relax  observing mega city lights.Friendly staff always ready for help. Extremely easy check in  check out . Exercise room 24 hours access.Perfect white towels  quality toiletries.  Most advantage point is location. Waterfront of the lagoon. Easy  pleasure walking distance to the beach  Hilton Hawaiian Village. Less crowds than at the center of Waikiki.Planning to stay in only this resort very soon again.Thank you for everything! Appreciate your business.
Reviews.Author: all_family

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Stay at the Waikiki Marina Resort My husband and I stayed at the Waikiki Marina Resort for two nights. Everything was wonderful. The room was clean and comfortable. The view was beautiful. It was one of the best hotels we ever stayed in. Having a full kitchen made the stay more relaxing because we could have breakfast and dinner in the room. Outstanding front desk staff. Friendly and helpful with a lot of aloha. Excellent hotel for families. We would recommend this hotel to all our friends and family.
Reviews.Author: wakii

Reviews.Content: Very nice lanai and lovely rooms I went to Hawaii with my mother and brother to visit my other brother who was temporarily stationed in Hawaii (he's in the Navy) the week of Thanksgiving. When we arrived at the hotel, we were a bit annoyed because they had taken away our room (through Shell Vacations) and moved us into the actual hotel. Same rooms and the same price, but they gave us a city view instead of a partial-ocean view, which we had requested and paid for. But it was fine. We got free breakfast everyday instead (which in my opinion was better). It was a very nice room. Quite clean, though I did see some dusty areas around the doors on the T.V armoire. We loved the balcony and even the city view. I don't regret the city view at all. There was construction going on outside, but it posed absolutely no problem. We didn't make much use of the kitchen, but were able to keep the ice frozen and our leftover cold. We didn't rent a car and didn't make use of the valet parking either. My Navy brother chauffeured us around, but when he had to park, he went to the parking lot behind the hotel. Be sure to feed the meter though. He had to run upstairs to get some change from my mom and when he came back down, he had a ticket. Overall, we loved the hotel. The downstairs and outside are a bit outdated and kind of ghost-town-ish, but it's a very nice hotel and rather quiet. We really loved the hotel. And we got a great price. There was an issue with the fire alarm going off in the middle of the night about 5 times, but they came over the speaker and told us it was a false alarm due to the construction next door. The construction was not going on at the time, so I'm not sure what triggered it, but it was very, very annoying and woke us all up. Other than that, very nice.
Reviews.Author: AmberL867

Reviews.Content: Convenient  Although the lobby and hallways are a little tired in appearance and in need of freshening up, the rooms are spacious, well-appointed, and very reasonably priced. I especially appreciated the kitchen, which helped us avoid restaurant fatigue. There are several convenient local markets within 15 mins. walk (ABC and Foodland at the Ala Moana Center), although be prepared for prices up to 25% higher than the mainland. Staff friendly and helpful. The construction is largely completed and the elevator problems (cited in earlier reviews) have been fixed. Our room was an 18th floor studio, city view. Road noise not too bad, although I imagine the closer you get to the ground, the louder it becomes. The hotel is a short walk (5 mins.) to the Hilton Lagoon and Waikiki Beach. Hotel pool nothing special, but who's complaining at $95 a night? Should also mention the restaurant/bar on the marina (under the Charthouse) which serves good/reasonably priced food and has a great happy hour!
Reviews.Author: EdwardPDX

Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, loved the room, excellent location The Ilikai was lovely, and everyone from the desk clerks to the maids were friendly and helpful. We walked to the convention center (about a 15 minute walk) every day for our meetings, and the soft sands of Waikiki beach were just a short walk in the other direction. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
Reviews.Author: CCBecky

Reviews.Content: Home away from home If you want a comfortable, clean, and convenient home away from home in Waikiki, this is the place to be! Our suite was basically like a studio apartment, complete with full kitchen, full bath, a king size bed, living room w pull out sofabed, tv, HBO, balcony, etc. - all at a very reasonable price. Plus the customer service and concierge services were excellent, providing us with lots of free resources and amenities (such as free bell/luggage service, umbrellas on a rainy day, key to gym shower if your flight leaves late at night and you have to check out by noon so you can still enjoy a full day at the beach, etc.). I was very impressed with the fact that we booked this hotel room via a timeshare co website (Shell) and they did not give us any type of sales talk or presentation. The only 2 minor set backs are that it was difficult and confusing to find (it is located inside the Ilikai Hotel and there is another hotel across the street called Waikiki Marina) and that it is a bit far from the main Waikiki strip with all the happenings, restaurants, shops, etc. (accessible by a 10 min bus ride - cost $2pp plus transfer within 2 hrs.). It is however a 5 min walk from the Hilton Hawaiian Hotel with lots of shops, not to mention penguins and pink flamingos! Some people have mentioned the construction next door and although we did hear it a little, it didn't bother us a bit. Great place to stay!
Reviews.Author: jamieCalifornia

Reviews.Content: A great holiday We booked the reservation through Shell Vacations' website with no problems.We arrived in Honolulu late evening(Sept.23th) and check-in ( on 2nd floor of Ilikai-hotel) was quick and professional.Our appartment was very clean, well equipped and according to the type we had booked. Daily cleaning: very good and professional.The customer-service: professional.Ideal location: at the marine harbour and very close ( 200 yards) from Waikiki-beach.Overall: we enjoyed very much our holidays.Congratulations to the Waikiki Marina Resort team!Marc Cornelis-- Belgium (Europe)
Reviews.Author: Vincent97

Reviews.Content: Great Affordable Place to Enjoy Hawaii We looked online at several hotels and read many reviews on different sites. We were a little concerned about some of the reviews on TripAdvisor but the kitchen and location really sold us. We were happily surprised (and relieved) once we arrived.We spent a week in late Sept, with two children, 4 and 9 in Honolulu and we had a rental car the entire time. The building is somewhat dated but the entrance and all the interior areas are clean and elegant. The back of the hotel has a great veranda to hang out and look over the marina and the ocean.We went to the second floor to check in. The Marina Resort is part of the Ilikai Hotel. The building is part hotel, part privately owned condos and part time-share. The first floor has the desk and concierge for the Ilikai Hotel and the Marina Resort desk is on the second floor. We read about issues with the elevators but we did not experience any long waits or anything negative about the elevators. They do have additional bathing suit elevators on the backside of the main elevator lobby. These were great coming in from the beach and the pool. Each floor also had 2 washers and 2 dryers which really helped with the kids clothes (plus we went home with our packed clothes washed!)The RoomWe had two Double Beds and a sleeper sofa. All were very comfortable. It was almost like a suite. The kids had more than enough room to spread out. There was also a desk, nightstand, small table, four chairs, and an entertainment center that provided drawer space and some storage. The kitchen was a full kitchen, not a kitchenette (four burner stove with oven, refrigerator, microwave oven, large sink, cupboards, toaster, coffeemaker). It was fully stocked with pots, pans, mixing bowls, cooking utensils, plates, cups, glasses, and silverware. We went to the grocery store to stock up on breakfast foods, cold cuts, and snacks. It was a lot of fun cooking breakfast in the room while the kids slept in and then got ready for the beach. My wife even made cookies! The hotel provided daily towels, emptied trash and made the beds, in addition to daily soap/shampoo/lotion bottles.The room was clean and comfortable, albeit the furniture a was a little dated. We had a TV with cable and there is Internet access in the hotel room for an additional fee. I was able to get some free wi-fi in the lobby and the veranda but it was hit and miss. The shower was larger than nornal, but was standup only, no tub. The bathroom itself was large as well with a full length mirror on the door. The kitchen also had a bar counter and the kids enjoyed eating breakfast and snacks on the bar stools. The balcony was adequate with two chairs, a small round table and a lounge chair, although this is where you could really tell the age of the hotel. We made sure to ask for a room that did not face the construction at the Marriott Hotel. We had no issues with noise at all. The pool is small but the kids liked it since it was never really busy. This was one of the weaker areas of the hotel. We went to the lagoon between the hotel and the beach but the water was cooler than the ocean and the sand very hard. You could tell it was man-made with concrete right below the sand's surface. Waikiki Beach is only a 4-5 minute walk from the backside of the hotel. We were able to find some parking on the backside of the hotel but we had to pay for valet when we couldn't find any. On the the downside, valet was $25 per day. We did however, get a voucher to be used when we arrived and when we departed for bellman service.Overall, we were pleased with our stay. The staff was always prompt and courteous in responding to our requests. Beware: the little convenience store on the first floor was quite expensive so be sure to make a trip to the grocery store or Wal-Mart , which is just a 5 minute drive away....or even the ABC store at the corner across from McDonalds.
Reviews.Author: Longhorns_08

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Room, Great Staff This hotel is a bargain. The rooms are big and most importantly, CLEAN!I booked this hotel by contacting them directly and they were extremely helpful. I received my email confirmation and everything went smoothly. We arrived at the hotel a bit earlier than check-in so they told us they would do their best to get our room ready and call us when it was ready. They gave us suggestions for some nearby restaurants to eat at in the meantime. The room took a little bit longer than originally mentioned, but it was worth it. We were given a free valet voucher which covered gratuity. The valet brought our luggage up to the room and was extremely polite. We had requested two full-size beds and, to our surprise the room came with these in addition to a full kitchen (stove, refigerator, sink, utensils), a queen size pull out couch.It's minutes away from the main shipping strip in Waikiki with high end stores such as Dior, Louis Vuitton, etc...I would definitely stay in this hotel again.-lee
Reviews.Author: bda337

Reviews.Content: Short but memorable stay The Shell Vacation Hospitality we received was wonderful; Angie was very accommodating and our room was very clean and adequate for my Mother, two sisters, and me. We chose the green savings, but the room was straightened, beds were made, and fresh linens were provided daily. We were in the heart of Waikiki and could walk to almost everything we wanted. TheBus was convenient for short trips. We had scheduled tours for two days, but could have been happy just relaxing in our room. This resort is a part of the Ilikai Hotel, which was undergoing some changes at the moment, but from our check-in to our check-out, the service we received was exceptional. We even stored our luggage for about 10 hours after check-out so we could continue to explore Honolulu.
Reviews.Author: CountryCousin47

Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! We stayed at Waikiki Marina Resort from 7nights from Sept 7 - 14. Location of this resort is excellent. 5 min walk from Waikiki beach - right next door to the Hilton. Rooms are modern and clean. Bus stop right in front of the resort and walking distance to the mall. I highly recommend this resort.
Reviews.Author: italia123

Reviews.Content: Great hotel and affordable! We stayed in this hotel for 1 week and loved it. Room is very clean and spacious. Large balcony and kitchen. The location is really good because its a walking distance to the mall and beach. The bus stop is in front of the hotel so it's really convenient. The staff is really friendly and helpful. The only downfall is the constructions around the hotel.
Reviews.Author: michelleunderwood

Reviews.Content: Great Vacation This hotel is really nice. Having a nice kitchen helps us save money. Theres constructions going on around the building so we were kinda worried when we book the reservation. It didn't even bother us since we are out all day. Huge room and balcony. Great staff especially the guy that works at the frontdesk every morning. He always smile everytime we go in to their office. I would most likely go back!!
Reviews.Author: underdog28

Reviews.Content: great hotel BUT Great room but ongoing construction next door. Room was clean, updated, huge, nice kitchen, balcony, small view of beach.As i was there for business, I did not mind the noise that went all during the hours 8-5 - I was gone all day anyway. no restaurant or ameniites but a stones throw from the Hilton Hawaiian but half the cost.
Reviews.Author: cincinSeattle

Reviews.Content: IlikaiI would recommend it to a friend       Construction next door
Reviews.Author: Kowabunga

Reviews.Content: Great Staff!!!! For the price, it is an excellent value I wasn't sure about this hotel at first, because there is construction next door. The second day I was there, the staff upgraded me to a better location. The suite was nice and fully stocked with full kitchen except food, of course. The cleaning staff occasionally appeared but overall it was a wonderful holiday at a very nice hotel. One of the concierges was paricularly helpful.Loved it!!!! .
Reviews.Author: gracious1

Reviews.Content: Better than reviewed I was looking for a way to cancel our reservations after reading the bad reviews on this website. I am glad I didn't. The hotel was fine. We had read other reviews so knew where the check in desk was so that was not a problem and we didn't rent a car so didn't have a parking problem. There is a bus stop directly in front of the hotel so unless this is your first trip and you want to drive around the island why get a rental car? Per this website we knew there was construction going on so asked for a room in a wing farther away but even from the outside the noise was not bad. Others on the website complained about traffic noise. We had a room facing the street on the third floor but with the balcony door closed never heard it. If you are looking to hang out on your balcony this is not the hotel for you assuming you get a streetside room.There are some older I assume condo owners on the property reflected by the poolside lift for handicapped people so we avoided the pool. If a cool pool scene is what you're looking for than this is not the hotel for you. We went to the lagoon that is right next door. Except for a rooftop restaurant there are no on property restaurants or coffee shops but a one block walk will take you to the same coffee shop that travelers staying at the HHV eat at when they are fleeing the high priced breakfasts there. So again if the pool scenes is not important to you this is a decent place to stay and save money. As menioned in other reviews there are showers and no bath tubs but who takes a bath in hotel bath tubs anyway?
Reviews.Author: pjmaeda

Reviews.Content: Enjoyable stay the entire week I had to stay for an entire week, while relocating for a job. Could not have been more pleased about the service and amenities the room had to offer. I had a clean, modern room that was very spacious and had decent views. Would recommend for anyone to stay at this location. Walking distance close to many attractions and restaurants. Aloha!
Reviews.Author: MissAZ

Reviews.Content: Unsure at booking, but Glad we did! Stayed a weekend at this property, which as others have stated, is a 'hotel-within-a-hotel.' A little concerned due to the reviews, but the full kitchen, walking distance to the park and the major mall swayed us in the end. And we didn't regret our choice! Luckily we had been informed when booking that the front desk was located on the second floor, so we bypassed the Ilikai Hotel desk in the lobby and went straight upstairs using what looked like a fire exit stairwell as some of the elevators were not working. Heck, we started using the staff elevators since a small sign by the main elevators said where it was. It was quick, and we were on the 18th floor! The front desk staff were pleasant and helpful, and pointed out a Ilikai bell staff tip form that Shell pays for. We were the only ones checking in, and my husband and son got a drink from the water cooler and lounged on the sofa while I signed in. The room was clean, comfortable and had the air-conditioning on. Bliss! We had stated in our reservation that we decline the maid service for our two-night stay, so we did not see them but we did find extra towels in the bathroom. We didn't go to the pool, or go out on the balcony, but with a city view room we kept the lanai door closed and did not have a problem with outdoor noise. I was surprised to find a 'Room Service in Paradise' menu in the room, a local company that delivers meals from various restaurants around town to your door. It was interesting to read the menus of all those restaurants and know you could order whatever they had. Imagine a room service menu with more than three kinds of cuisine!  My family enjoyed our stay, especially for the full kitchen with microwave! My DS is four years old, so although there was no bathtub, only a shower, he was okay (I loved the wide shower head) and it was a blessing to be able to buy some popsicles and juice for him and keep it in the room. A blender and coffeemaker also included, we thought about making frappes or smoothies (next time, if we stay longer!) We even bought popsicles for treats when back in the room.  Check-out was easy, a video checkout service. I did see on our paperwork that it should be at a pre-arranged time, but 20 minutes before check-out time a quick call to the front desk to say that I didn't pre-arrange the time and need to leave in 20 minutes. I was told there was no additional charges by the staff member and I was simply asked to leave the keys in the room. Stayed at other SVC properties in addition to Hiltons, Hyatts, Sheratons and other chains. The feel here was more of staying in a condo than at a resort, but we chalked it up to the unusual hotel-within-a-hotel premise, and just enjoyed our stay.
Reviews.Author: machbird

Reviews.Content: Better Than Expected Based on the past few reviews, our expectations for this hotel within the Renaissance Ilikai were pretty low, however when we arrived our trepidation slowly subsided. I do say slowly due to tired exterior of the hotel and our experience during check in. When we checked in (on the second floor) our room wasn't quite ready yet. I should mention that we were about an hour and a half ahead of official check in time. To fill in the time the hotel concierge introduced himself, saying he could help us save money during our stay. Though, his help seemed more like a pitch for a timeshare. The Ilikai security was more helpful with information about getting around.After about 30 minutes or so, we got our keys and were off to the slow elevators. By incorporating some previous advice found on TA into our elevator calling strategy the maximum time we waited for an elevator was 5 minutes. One person would go around the corner and call the lone bather's elevator, while the other would call the main elevators then wait and we'd jump on the first available car. We figured this imposed only a small negative externality on the other guests.Our room was on the 13th floor and had a city view. The room was clean and bright, I think it had granite floors and counters in the kitchen and bathroom. The upholstery and linen pattern seemed a bit out of style but looked clean. The kitchen was fully stocked with the necessary things to make a meal, though, nothing to clean the dishes. (We later found that the maid would do our dishes sometime in the afternoon along with the usual daily upkeep).The hotel location was about an eight minute walk from the Ala Moana Center which had two supermarkets for groceries, plus a number of restaurants. The hotel was also a five minute walk to the Hilton Lagoon which seemed connected to the tip of Waikiki Beach. To get to the more touristy and crowded Waikiki Beach Park (which offered board and snorkel rentals) was about a 10 - 15 min bus ride. Though we did prefer the beaches in Kailua, but that is another review.We did not have any issues with the noise from the construction at the Hilton next door. I should note that did have another wing of the Ilikai as a noise buffer.The only thing that woke us up in the morning was the sun rising over the city. The east facing room was luckily situated over a bend in the road below, so the sunrise was not blocked by any of the surrounding hotels. A couple demerits in addition to the concierge: The AC controls didn't seem to work, so the only way to shut off the blasting AC was to open the sliding doors leading to the lanai. Also the maid service seemed a bit wasteful in replacing even the unused towels rather than using the floor policy found in other hotels.I should also note, that during our stay one afternoon some of the (Ilikai) workers and permanent residents protested in front of the building. It had something to do with the new ownership, though didn't get much of the details.I'd consider staying here again, but if all else equal, I'd preferably stay at a newer hotel.
Reviews.Author: Choco_Pies

Reviews.Content: Rip Off Many, many problems. First day visit to office to be informed we'd been given a room for city view when we requested and paid for an ocean view. Office staff (especially one female) was very rude. After 2 days of discussion we were given the worst room (owner/rental) ever. It hadn't been updated since early 70s and certainly showed it. Appliances didn't work right, it was the most unclean room I've ever rented (and most expensive), the towels, bed linens and dishes were a bunch of OLD missmatches, no cleaning service (have always had at least one day a week, usually two) and we had to wash linens and towels before we left or be charged for it. The pool was small and closed in by 8 foot walls so you couldn't even see the ocean. Very few activities, we spent most of our time enjoying the activities at the Hilton, next door. The elevators were the worst. Take a book along to read while you wait and wait. A new Hilton is going up next door so the noise was awful, 7:00 am until 4:30 pm ever day but Sunday. Construction began the day before we left on the hotel on the other side so I can only imagine how the noise level has increased.I can say the view was GREAT. The only thing that kept us there.Would I ever go back? NO Would I recommend it to anyone? NO.
Reviews.Author: Times2

Reviews.Content: Resort??? Very strange place - since it is within another hotel. Went to the front desk not realizing this. They directed to the second floor to an office for check-in. (Well, once we finally got on the elevator.) The staff was okay, but not overly friendly. Our room on the 12th floor (city view) was not ready. Came back at check-in time to learn we were moved to the 5th floor. Assured that this is a better room since it was a partial ocean view. We were told that an owner didn't like the room since it was only the 5th, so they bumped us. Got to the room which was not a bad room, although it smelled musty, only to find out that yes we did have a partial ocean view, but the REAL view was of the VERY loud construction. From 7:30 am til around 6:00pm. Bed was old and had a huge dip in it. NO RESTAURANT. Also I used the shuttle company the hotel recommended (Reliable Shuttle)... Had trouble on transfers to and from airport. 1/2 hour late for our return to the airport - and crammed in as many people as possible. The pros: Walking distance to the beach, room is large enough and did have nice kitchenette, also clean. The bellmen were very nice and friendly. Helped us more than the desk. The word resort in the hotel name is VERY deceiving - nothing resort like about this property AT all. Explains why most of the people we ran into seemed so grumpy. Would never stay here again. What I thought would be a nice treat for Valentine's Day turned out to be a huge disappointment.
Reviews.Author: loventhebeach

Reviews.Content: Clean, but no cigar We stayed in this hotel for a week, in January, 2008. Although I had read the reviews here and elsewhere, none of them really set out what's happening at this hotel.The positives: The hotel room we got was spacious, well-appointed, and very nicely cleaned. There was a good kitchen, a good bed, a couch, an armchair/ottoman, and a pleasant bathroom. The hotel is next to the beach adjoining the Hilton Hawaian Village, which is a very nice beach. The rest: This property is in some sort of transition - two out of three of the restaurants were closed, and one had been completely removed. The nicer swimming pool (the one shown in some of the internet photos I saw) is boarded up with a Do Not Trespass sign. At any given time, only a few of the available elevators actually are working. This results in long delays for even small movements, with the opening of an elevator door preceding a crush of people. While you meet people as you stand there waiting for an elevator, many of them are irritated by the wait, and not feeling friendly.There seems to be a lot of tension in this place. Some of the residents are condo owners, some are tourists. I don't know what has lead to the closures of the restaurants and the pool. It does not create a festive atmosphere.Many of the facilities in the hotel are only semi-functional. You want change for the laundry soap machine - you (wait), take an elevator to the change machine promised on the 12th floor, only to see a sign on it that it's broken. Back to the elevator, wait, down to the ground floor, get change, back to the elevator, wait, back to the laundry room, put change in the soap machine, and get no soap, etc. This became very irritating as the days passed.We had a city view room. I would recommend getting a different view, unless you like a lot of traffic noise, and a lot of big city out your window.Overall, we had a good time - the hotel is in Hawaii, after all, but I would not consider staying here again. They call it renovation, but it looks like decline to me.
Reviews.Author: RoverUSA

Reviews.Content: Disappointing As SVC members we expected a modern, well-maintained property with 4-star amenities like those we encountered on the Big Island and Kauai. The Waikiki Marina Resort at the Ilikai is not. It's tired and out-dated. The elevators are so slow that you must plan for an exasperating 10 minute wait for each trip up or down. Hot water for showers is in short supply in the early morning. Staff at the Ilikai hotel that shares the building were unfriendly to SVC and other time-share clients. Noise from heavy construction equipment next door permeates the daylight hours 6 days a week. It's a good thing that we enjoy Hawaii even under less than satisfactory circumstances, otherwise the place might have spoiled a good time. We won't be going back to the Ilikai, and wouldn't recommend it to others.
Reviews.Author: Poncho88

Reviews.Content: best beach area       beach area in front of hotel
Reviews.Author: tripwithgrandkids

Reviews.Content: Shell Vacations Club is disappointing       Marina Side of the Hotel
Reviews.Author: plechadores

Reviews.Content: Loved It! Stayed here for pre-cruise: Oct 31 for 3days. Booked the rm thru Hotwire. Check in had been moved to the 2nd floor, it was super fast  friendly! We were given a free upgrade on the 8th floor with a great ocean view overlooking the lagoon next door at the Village. We were absolutely delighted  in heaven with our stay here. The room was over 500 sq ft. with one wall of windows, so lots of natural light. It was clean as a whistle, had a super comfortable king bed, sofa bed couch, chair with ottoman, lots of great lighting, kitchen with basics, large bathrm, (no tub) but huge shower stall, desk  TV armoire. The ocean view lania was huge and private. We enjoyed our coffee out there in the a.m. and the last moments of the day there. The BUS  other shuttles stopped in front. We could walk to several restaurants right near by..as was an ABC, car rental etc. There was construction going on, but this was one of the most soundproof places we have ever stayed. Its also had A/C, which was not loud like a jet engine in your room. We had no problems with the elavators, cuz we just walked over to the supposed wet bathing suit elevators that no one ever used and always had immediate service. We did not use the pool, but it looked really nice. We walked over to the beach in front of the Hawaiin Village and enjoyed their Fri night fireworks from our lanai! We would stay here again as it was on the quiet side of town, yet close enough to walk to the huge Al Moana Center .Simply a great place at a great price with great service.
Reviews.Author: BackHomeCt

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Lousy Pool       Kitchen and Bar area
Reviews.Author: Airedale2

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay! My husband, 2 boys (5  10) and I stayed here last week of August. We were able to get a great rate (AAA rate $146/night)which we bookedthrough their website. We really enjoyed our stay here. I liked that this hotel was at the quieter end of Waikiki. Yes, the outside of thehotel does look dated and a little tired but the rooms have been updated, look modern and are spacious (about 550 sq. ft.). The rooms look exactly like on the resort's website- we had a king size bed with queen sleeper/sofa. The room was very clean and we loved that it had a kitchen so we were able to have a lot of our meals in. Our room was facing Ala Moana Blvd and with the sliding doors to the balcony open, you can hear all the traffic but with the sliding doors closed it blocked most of the noise. Construction is still going on next door but we never heard any noise from it. Also, I knowthe hotel was almost fully booked when we stayed there but they must have some great insulation or thick walls because I never heard any noise from any of our neighbors. Housekeeping was very good- we always came back to a clean room and they even washed the dirty dishes that we left from breakfast one morning. The office personnel were very nice and they offer complimentary bellhop services upon your arrival and also when you leave. Also at the office you can get free beach towels to use for the day.The only negative was as the other reviewers have said are the slow elevators. They have 3 elevators in the lobby but only 2 of them were in service. There were 2 other elevators that the hotel were allowing guests to use- the Bather's elevator and the Freight elevator. After a few days though, the Bather's elevator was also out of service. My family and I just used the stairs the whole time we were there since our room was on the 3rd floor. Just a few tips: If you rent a car and don't want to pay $25/day for the hotel's valet parking, you can park at the parking garage adjacent to the hotel on Hobron Lane for $14/day with in  out privileges. For groceries they have a Safeway about 1.5 miles away and a Costco about 15 minutes drive away. Best beach nearby is Ala Moana Beach Park- about 15 minute walk. The water is very calm and has soft sand. Not as busy and packed as Waikiki beach- mostly localsgo here. Ala Moana Beach has lifeguards, restrooms and snack bar (they serve great loco moco, yum:)). We went to the beach in front of the Hilton Hawaiian Village (about 10 minute walk) and we didn't like it as much. Waves are a little stronger and lots of rocks in the sand- ouch!I would definitely recommend this resort and would stay here again.
Reviews.Author: DJsMom

Reviews.Content: fantastic@! This place is great! We are owners of Shell Vacations and used our points for two rooms at the Waikiki Marina Resort at the Ilikai. We were treated great, the staff at the check in office were very friendly. The rooms had robes and welcome chocolates, notecards, cold water, etc waiting for us. We had daily maid service, which is unusual for a timeshare. The room is large for two people, although for 4 people it would be cramped, only a king size bed and fold out couch. The location is good, not right on Waikiki Beach, but a short walk. But we didn't have to fight the awful Waikiki traffic on the main road, we rented a car and could just pull right out of our hotel to get into town. The valet parking guys were wonderful, we came and went constantly and we never had to wait more than a minute or two for them to get our car. There is construction next door, so the walk to the beach is a little longer than usual, but still only a few short minutes. The Shell Vacations Club had fresh beach towels available at all times, a concierge with info on activities, etc, and a lei greeting when we arrived. The views of the city are fantastic, and we had no construction noise whatsoever, even though the hotel next door is being built. We would definately stay here again!
Reviews.Author: joanbosoxfn

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hawaii This was our second time in Hawaii. Our stay was wonderful. My husband and I had a great time... the room was spacious, beautiful, clean- the balcony was incrediably big... we loved waking up and watching the sunrise on there... we stayed there from Jan. 6th through the 12th... room service was on Monday and Wed. The only thing that bothered us was that the elevator took a long time to come. But overall, everyone was friendly, front desk people were great and helpful. I would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone. The room was in great condition and we only got the best of the best. This hotel is away from the city... a beautiful and short walk, maybe about 15 mins to get to the city place- Hawaii overall was an excellent trip.
Reviews.Author: HawaiiLuverz

Reviews.Content: Nice Place, Good location, Would stay again!       Bathroom
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Waikiki Woes Much like some of the other reviews posted on this site regarding the Waikiki Marina Resort at Ilikai tower, we also felt that we were treated as third rate guests. Our issues started the minute we got here. We were traveling with an elderly couple (separate rooms, of course) who upon getting their room key on the 18th floor found that their key didn't work and had to wait in the hot hallway for someone to bring them a new key. There was a guest book in the room with useful information including that there was no need to bring your own towels to the pool area as they would be provided for you there. After asking to receive a towel at the pool we were told that our rooms do not get this service. The concierge service is located across the street below the Starbucks. We went to get our coupon books and basically just had them handed to us with no welcome or smile. One of the things they advertised was a two for one meal coupon for Tanaka of Tokyos. We went to eat at this restaurant (which was great) and were told that this coupon could not be honored because it was actually a copy of their coupon. I brought this issue to the front desk and they simply said it wasn't their issue and we would need to take this up with the concierge service.While sitting by the pool we also asked to receive an ashtray and some water. The waitress said she was busy and pointed out the water cooler to us for water. We went to paddles bar and asked for the ashtray and they said they were out of them and gave us an empty soda can.Our room wasn't cleaned the first two days we stayed here. We finally asked the front desk about this and they indicated that upon check in you need to specify how often you would like to have your room cleaned. Once we explicitly said we would like to have our room cleaned at least every two days, the cleaning staff wouldn't come in until at least 4PM.Our shower light was burnt out when we arrived and we were told this would be fixed. It took three days before this actually happened.We don't consider ourselves to be very picky guests which is why we decided to give this hotel a shot even after some of the other reviews. After actually seeing the service you receive and the way you are treated, we would never stay at this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good value, nice room We recently returned from a trip to Oahu and Maui. We spent three days at the Waikiki Marina Resort. This resort is a time share property located at the Illikai Renissance resort. Same resort, different name, different price. The Prices for the Illikai were in the area of $215 a night. Our room at the Waikiki Marina resort was $139. Nice size room with a kitchenette. Great for us and our two young kids. The pools at the resort are nice, as well as the bars and entertainment. Look for the 8 pm fireworks on the beach on Friday night. The booklet in the room said maid service was $45 extra, but dont worry, that wasnt the case. The maids were not an extra service and did a great job. Lots of places to eat in the area and a short walk to the beach.. have fun. JKL
Reviews.Author: SonJon

Reviews.Content: Second Class Guest at Waikiki Marina Resort I just got back from our stay at this hotel. Here are some information to help others who may stumble upon this place:-Waikiki Marina Resort owns a block of 80 rooms at the Ilikai Hotel (Renaissance) which they rent out separately.-We got a 3rd floor room on the Ilikai tower with no view.-Some of the amenities of the Ilikai that are availalbe to regular guests are not available to WMR guests.-There is no bell service or valet parking for WMR guests. The Ilikai staff will not help you if you mention that you're a WMR guest. I was given a cart to haul our luggage a long way across two buildings and into an elevator to our room.(Funny thing: Since I was wearing a hawaiian shirt and had a luggage cart, I was mistaken for a bell boy several times by other guests.)-You CAN'T use room service if you're a WMR guest.-However, you CAN charge meals to your room at the two other restaurants in house.-The WMR seems to have their own maid staff as our rooms were cleaned late in the day, only after I saw the other maids leave our floor.-No in-house concierge. There is a guy across the street (outside travel/activities agent) that is available if you need anything.-Front desk was only open limited hours. If you need help at night, you'd have to leave a message and wait until morning.All this being said, the Waikiki Marina Resort was listed as a 4 star hotel on Hotwire. I would rate the experience a 3 star at best. The Ilikai is a bit old and would probably be a 3.5 star in my book, but since we felt like second-class guests at this resort, I would only give it 3 stars.If you can get this for a 3-star price and can live with the above mentioned details, then it is probably a fair deal. Otherwise, I would consider other hotels such as the Prince Hotel (4.5 stars) next door which we also stayed in and highly recommend.Aloha.
Reviews.Author: msquare
